title: Poch after loss: Wearing U.S. shirt 'not enough'
content: Mauricio Pochettino was left visibly frustrated after the USMNT's shock 1-0 defeat to Panama in the Concacaf Nations League, bluntly telling his players it was not enough to just simply show up in the national team shirt and expect to win.

title: Bronny has season-high 17 points in Lakers' loss
content: Bronny James scored a season-high 17 points on 7-for-10 shooting and added five assists, three rebounds and a block in 30 minutes of playing time against the Bucks.

title: 11-seed Drake stuns Mizzou, as coach 'expected'
content: Drake, a No. 11 seed relying heavily on D-II transfers, had a 15-point lead whittled to one with 4:28 left but held off Missouri to advance in the NCAA tournament.

title: Warriors' Curry exits win early with pelvic injury
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry was ruled out in the second half of Thursday's 117-114 win over the Raptors because of a pelvic contusion.

title: Skenes' 1-of-1 rookie card fetches record $1.11M
content: Pirates pitcher Paul Skenes' 2024 Topps Chrome Update MLB debut patch autograph card sold for a stunning $1.11 million, including buyer's premium.

title: Ovechkin nets No. 888; Caps clinch playoff berth
content: Alex Ovechkin scored his 888th career goal to move seven away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL record.

title: Wood booked for signing autographs in NZ win
content: Chris Wood picked up a yellow card for signing autographs and taking pictures with fans during New Zealand's win over Fiji in their World Cup qualifier on Thursday.

title: McNeese scripts 'biggest day' in upset of Clemson
content: McNeese coach Will Wade and his boom box-toting manager are moving on in March Madness after the 12th-seeded Cowboys held off No. 5 seed Clemson in the first bracket buster of the NCAA tournament.

title: Your guide to March Madness Day 1: Recaps, every winner's chance to advance, more
content: Whether you missed the action or simply want to relive it, here's a rundown of all 16 games from Thursday.

title: Two years after losing the Texas job, Chris Beard right at home at Ole Miss
content: The university and the city of Oxford have welcomed the coach as he rebuilds the men's basketball team.

title: Way-Too-Early look at 2026 NFL free agents: Which playmakers could be available next March?
content: Who are the top names to know for next year's NFL free agency? Here's our list of who might be available and has a chance to get paid.

title: Debating free agency: Which teams improved the most over the past two weeks?
content: We asked 10 experts to weigh in on the most improved teams, top bargains and head-scratching decisions.

title: From All-Star to architect: How Buster Posey plans to rebuild the Giants
content: The future Hall of Fame catcher turned president of baseball operations has a vision to bring baseball glory back to San Francisco.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Capitals reign at No. 1, plus pickups for the fantasy playoffs
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted. And here's one fantasy player to target per team.

title: How rookie goaltender Dustin Wolf saved the Calgary Flames' season
content: The Northern California native, and 214th overall pick in 2019, has his team right in the playoff mix.

title: USMNT loses to Panama again in worst performance of Pochettino era
content: Panama made it three straight victories over the U.S. in tournament play as Mauricio Pochettino's side slumped to a 1-0 defeat in the Concacaf Nations League semifinal that showed the Americans at their worst.

title: Kane: 'Aura' improved after Spurs to Bayern move
content: Harry Kane sees a real chance of winning the next men's Ballon d'Or, saying his "aura" as a player has improved since joining Bayern Munich.

title: 'You're my idol': Henry joins Panama celebrations
content: Panama's Cecilio Waterman celebrated one of the biggest goals in his country's history, to defeat the USMNT, with his idol Thierry Henry.

title: Vini Jr. saves Brazil with late winner vs. Colombia
content: A last-minute goal by Vinícius Júnior secured Brazil's 2-1 win over Colombia in World Cup qualifying on Thursday, helping his team and millions of fans avoid more disappointment.

title: Jiménez double sends Mexico past Canada
content: Raúl Jiménez scored in the opening minute and again in the 75th, lifting Mexico into the Concacaf Nations League final with a 2-0 victory over Canada on Thursday night.

title: Huijsen 'proud' of Madrid links after Spain debut
content: Dean Huijsen said he is "proud" of links with Real Madrid, after making his Spain debut in a 2-2 draw away at the Netherlands on Thursday.

title: Højlund: Wasn't mocking 'idol' Ronaldo with 'Siu'
content: Rasmus Højlund said he was not trying to mock Cristiano Ronaldo after hitting the Portuguese star's famed 'Siu' celebration after scoring the winner for Denmark against Portugal in Copenhagen on Thursday.

title: Croatia upset France in Nations League first leg
content: Goals from Ante Budimir and Ivan Perisic steered Croatia to a deserved 2-0 win over France in their Nations League quarterfinal first leg in Split on Thursday, as the return of Kylian Mbappe and Ousmane Dembele failed to get the visitors to fire.

title: Is the 2025 field the most talented NASCAR has ever seen?
content: Twenty-five drivers in the 2025 NASCAR field have won Cup Series races, making it arguably the deepest ever.

title: The blessing and curse of UCLA's Lauren Betts' 6-7 height
content: Lauren Betts was called an alien, a giraffe. Now she's ready to dominate -- not for the bullies, for herself -- as UCLA goes for its first NCAA title.

title: From Dunk City to Rupp's Runts: Maryland's Crab Five the latest iconic CBB squad nickname
content: College basketball has produced many memorable squad nicknames over the years. Maryland's "Crab Five" is the latest.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Edwards' path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Who has the edge in Saturday's UFC Fight Night from London? An MMA fighter and betting insider make their picks.

title: MMA madness: 16 welterweights go head-to-head
content: Is your hoops bracket already busted? Welcome to MMA madness, where predictions -- and upsets -- abound!

title: Real or not: Fundora undisputed, Boots will unify, and Ryan will solve Mayer in rematch
content: Our experts discuss notable upcoming fights, Keith Thurman's return, the next American heavyweight and more.

title: NCAA Wrestling Championships: Schedule, rules, scoring, stats
content: The NCAA men's Division I wrestling championships start Thursday; here's how to watch Penn State, Iowa and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool set to rival Real Madrid for teen Dean Huijsen
content: Liverpool look set to rival Real Madrid for Bournemouth's Dean Huijsen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: "Transfer Should Be Put On Hold": Harish Salve To NDTV On Judge Cash Case
content: Calling himself a "trenchant critic" of the Collegium system Senior Advocate Harish Salve has said it is not equipped to deal with cases like the alleged recovery of huge piles of cash from Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma.

title: "Transfer Not Part Of Action": Supreme Court On Judge In Cash Row
content: The transfer of Delhi High Court judge Yashwant Varma is not linked to the recovery of a large stash of cash at his home, the Supreme Court said today.

title: "Not Trash Bin": Allahabad High Court Lawyers Reject Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The Allahabad High Court has is not a "trash bin", that court's Bar Association declared Friday morning, adding another twist to the growing controversy surrounding Justice Yashwant Varma and the recovery of a pile of cash from his home.

title: Video: Suspended Amid Honey Trap Row, Karnataka MLAs Carried Out By Marshals
content: Dramatic scenes played out at the Karnataka Assembly complex on Friday after 18 BJP MLAs were suspended following protests over alleged honey trap attempts against nearly 50 leaders, including ministers.

title: Who Is High Court Justice Yashwant Varma, At Centre Of Cash-In-Home Row
content: Justice Yashwant Varma - the Delhi High Court judge who finds himself at the centre of a controversy after unaccounted cash was found at his bungalow in the city - was appointed to the court in the city in October 2021.

title: "Nuanced Understanding": US Intelligence, State Department Back Gabbard
content: The US has released a statement in which it has praised Intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard for her "nuanced understanding" of the Indo-Pacific region. The statement comes days after her visit to India, during which she held a meeting with PM Modi.

title: Cops Share Key Details On Meerut Murder, Black Magic, Money Transfers
content: The police in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, have shared their key findings in the murder of a former Merchant Navy officer allegedly by his wife and her lover.

title: Why Missing Student Sudiksha Konanki's Parents Want Her Declared Dead
content: The parents of missing Indian student Sudiksha Konanki want their daughter declared dead to "seek closure", authorities told CNN.

title: Opinion: Why Is Trump Invoking JFK? Hint: Russia
content: Now that the Trump administration is avowedly in favour of peace with Russia, invoking JFK's memory works in their favour.

title: How Tattoos Got Venezuelans Deported From US Amid Immigration Crackdown
content: The US immigration officials appear to have taken tattoos as proof of the person being a member of Venezuelas most notorious gang, Tren de Aragua.

title: Young, Rich Indians Push Lamborghini, Mercedes-Maybach Sales
content: Lamborghini and Mercedes-Maybach plan to expand in India as a growing tribe of young, rich Indians splurge on super luxury cars, driving their sales to record levels.

title: Explained: Inside Donald Trump's Dismantling Of US Education Department
content: US President Donald Trump is close to fulfilling a long-standing conservative ambition: the complete dismantling of Department of Education.

title: "Separated In 2022": Chahal-Dhanashree Divorce Petition's Big Revelation
content: A family court on Thursday allowed the joint plea filed by cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and his estranged wife seeking divorce by mutual consent.

title: IPL 2025 Opening Match Likely To Get Abandoned. Here's Why
content: The IPL 2025 opener between Kolkata Knight Riders and Royal Challengers Bengaluru in Kolkata is under the threat of being abandoned.

title: "Maar Dungi": Influencer Apoorva Mukhija Fights With Security At Paris Gig
content: This incident comes amid ongoing controversy surrounding her participation in Samay Raina's YouTube show India's Got Latent, for which she allegedly faces multiple FIRs related to obscenity charges.

title: 'Rumours': SC clarifies on Justice Varma's transfer, report on 'cash recovery' likely today
content: The Supreme Court clarified that Justice Yashwant Varma's transfer to the Allahabad High Court is separate from the ongoing in-house enquiry into the alleged discovery of unaccounted cash at his residence. The court emphasized that the transfer proposal is independent and not connected to the incident involving the fire at Varma's home.

title: Heathrow shutdown: Counter-terrorism police leading probe
content: Hundreds of thousands of passengers faced disruptions as London's Heathrow Airport shut down due to a fire at a nearby electrical substation. The power outage led to cancellations or diversions of at least 1,350 flights, impacting global travel with ripple effects lasting several days.

title: 'Took her to the cops': Father of Meerut woman held for husband's murder
content: Muskan Rastogi confessed to murdering her husband with the help of her lover, after her father took her to the police. She attempted to hide the crime by dismembering the body and concealing it in a cement-filled drum. Investigators found evidence linking Muskan to her boyfriend Sahil, who was allegedly manipulated into participating in the murder.

title: 'Hope to rebuild ties with Canada': India after Trudeau's exit
content: India expressed readiness to rebuild ties with Canada, strained over Ottawa's harboring of anti-India elements. The relations deteriorated following accusations of Indian involvement in a Canadian citizen's assassination and Khalistani protests. Progress in ensuring Indian diplomats' safety could lead to resumption of visa services for Canadians, post-Trudeau's resignation as Liberal Party leader.

title: Trump vows to end crypto war, make America 'Crypto Capital of the World'
content: President Donald Trump announced his intention to make the US a leader in Bitcoin and cryptocurrency by ending the previous administration's regulatory constraints. He proposed new legislation for stablecoins and market structure, and highlighted initiatives like the Bitcoin Reserve. Trump emphasized the potential for economic growth, privacy, security, and maintaining US financial dominance.

title: 'Politically unfit, dolt': BJP slams Rahul over merit remark, K'taka quota
content: Rahul Gandhi faces criticism from BJP over his "merit a flawed concept" remark regarding caste census and the Karnataka government's decision to approve a 4% minority quota for Muslim contractors. BJP leaders Amit Malviya and Sambit Patra accuse Gandhi of undermining the value of merit and promoting appeasement politics for personal gain.

title: Watch: 18 suspended BJP MLAs carried out of Karnataka assembly
content: In the Karnataka assembly, 18 BJP MLAs were suspended for demanding a judicial probe into a "honey-trap" scandal involving a minister. Speaker UT Khader cited disrespectful behavior. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah assured a high-level investigation. Minister MB Patil defended the suspension, while Home Minister Parameshwara committed to a thorough probe after complaints are officially filed.

title: Shah takes 'kaala chashma' dig at Rahul's 'terrorists saw me' in Kashmir claim
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the Rajya Sabha, accusing him of ignoring development in Jammu and Kashmir. Shah emphasised the Modi government's zero-tolerance policy on terrorism and highlighted the abrogation of Article 370 as a fulfillment of the vision of the Constitution’s architects.

title: How Google DeepMind CEO may have just agreed with Microsoft's AI chief
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI could emerge in the next five to ten years, noting that current AI systems still face significant limitations in real-world context understanding. He emphasizes ongoing research and development while contrasting with more aggressive AGI timelines from other industry leaders.

title: 'Nimantran toh rishton ...': MEA's quip on Iftar invite from Pak embassy
content: The Ministry of External Affairs clarified the absence of Indian officials at the Pakistan High Commission's Iftar dinner, attributing it to current diplomatic relations. Pakistani officials expressed a desire for peaceful ties and mutual understanding to resolve longstanding issues, including Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Heathrow airport shut: Video shows massive fire raging overnight
content: Heathrow Airport in London experienced a massive power outage due to a fire at a nearby electrical substation, leading to the cancellation of at least 1,350 flights and affecting hundreds of thousands of passengers. The blackout also impacted nearby homes and businesses, causing evacuations and train service cancellations, with authorities working to extinguish the fire.

title: Join TOI's Amazing Heart, Amazing Life Medithon for expert insights
content: Heart diseases are becoming more prevalent due to lifestyle choices and genetic factors. Prevention through healthy habits, regular check-ups, and awareness is crucial. The Times of India will host a medithon on March 21 with top cardiologists discussing heart disease risks and prevention. Sessions will cover managing heart diseases and specific impacts on youngsters and women.

title: Nvidia CEO calls Trump-labeled 'National Security Threat' China’s top tech firm
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang praised Huawei's advancements in AI, labeling them as a major technological force in China despite US sanctions. He criticized the US approach to restricting Huawei. Huang also denied involvement in discussions about a consortium to invest in Intel’s factories alongside TSMC, Broadcom, and AMD.

title: Record! Hasan Nawaz scores fastest T20I century for Pakistan
content: Young Pakistani batter Hasan Nawaz made history by scoring the fastest century for Pakistan in T20 Internationals. He achieved this feat in just 44 balls during the third T20I against New Zealand, leading his team to a commanding 9-wicket victory in Auckland. The fourth T20I between the two sides is set to take place at Bay Oval, Mount Maunganui, on Sunday (March 23), while the fifth and final T20I will be held at Sky Stadium, Wellington, on Wednesday (March 26).

title: 'Disrespecting' national anthem? Petition filed against Bihar CM
content: A petition was filed in Bihar court against Chief Minister Nitish Kumar for alleged disrespect to the national anthem during a public event. Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav criticized Kumar and questioned his fitness to govern, suggesting his resignation amid concerns about his actions and statements.

title: 'Closely monitoring': What Centre told Parliament on Trump's tax threats
content: The US has imposed additional duties on steel and aluminium imports from all countries, including India, with no exemptions. The Indian government is evaluating the impact and continues efforts to double bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030 amidst rising trade tensions.

title: Watch: World champ Gukesh plays chess with Ashwin at CSK's den
content: Newly crowned world chess champion D Gukesh received a hero’s welcome from Chennai Super Kings at the MA Chidambaram Stadium and shared a special moment with veteran spinner Ravichandran Ashwin. Gukesh, who recently became the youngest world chess champion, is focused on performing well in upcoming tournaments while continuing to inspire athletes across disciplines.

title: 'Wannabe Bhindranwale reciting Guru Granth Sahib in jail': Shah on Amritpal
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah detailed the measures taken by his ministry in handling extremist Amritpal Singh in Punjab, stating he is now reciting Guru Granth Sahib in Assam jail. Singh, the leader of 'Waris Punjab De', faced multiple charges, including plotting against India with ISI's support. His detention under the National Security Act was extended until 2025.

title: ‘Obscene videos of judges, ministers’: Honeytrap claims rock K'taka politics
content: A substantial political controversy has erupted in the Karnataka assembly over allegations of a honeytrap scandal involving a senior minister and 48 others, including legislators, politicians, and judges. The issue was highlighted by Minister K N Rajanna, who confessed to being honey-trapped himself, leading to calls for a thorough investigation.

title: Union minister slams Allahabad HC's 'grabbing breasts not rape attempt' ruling
content: Union minister for women and child development, Annapurna Devi, criticized the Allahabad High Court's decision to downgrade charges in a sexual assault case involving an 11-year-old girl. The court ruled the actions did not constitute attempted rape. Devi urged the Supreme Court to address the verdict, warning it could send a harmful message to society.

title: Magnitude 5 earthquake hits Iran, minor damage reported in Natanz area
content: A magnitude 5 earthquake struck the Natanz area in Iran's Isfahan province, causing minor damage but no immediate casualties. Windows in several villages were shattered. The region houses a significant nuclear facility, although its impact on the site remains unclear. Authorities are assessing the situation and monitoring for further effects, as Iran frequently experiences earthquakes.

title: Net bowler dismisses Babar Azam ahead of NZ vs PAK ODI series – WATCH
content: Star batter Babar Azam faced a challenging practice session ahead of Pakistan's ODI series against New Zealand, being dismissed LBW by a net bowler. Pakistan, led by Salman Agha in T20Is, aim to rebound from a disappointing ICC Champions Trophy campaign as they prepare for the ODIs starting March 29.

title: Bride suffers burn injuries during photoshoot after colour bomb malfunctions
content: A Canada-based Indian-origin couple's wedding in India faced an unexpected mishap when a colour bomb malfunctioned, injuring the bride. Despite following all safety measures, the device misfired during a photoshoot, burning the bride's back and singeing her hair.

title: Watch: Chilling secrets inside Sahil Shukla's room in Saurabh Rajput murder case
content: Authorities in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut unearthed alarming details involving Sahil Shukla, accused of murdering ex-navy officer Saurabh Rajput. Sahil’s room, filled with black magic symbols, hints at his obsession with the occult, reportedly exploited by co-accused, Muskan Rastogi, who manipulated him to execute the crime.

title: Heathrow Airport power outage: Air India cancels all flights to London
content: Air India has canceled flights to and from London Heathrow until the end of March 21 due to a major power outage caused by a fire at a nearby electrical substation. The disruption affects over 1,300 flights globally, with significant rerouting to alternative European airports.

title: Why are Germans being detained by US immigration?
content: ICE detained four German nationals, including Green Card holder Fabian Schmidt, in the US, raising alarm over aggressive immigration checks. Detainees faced unpredictable interrogations, held without clear charges, despite having valid travel documents. Berlin advised caution for German travelers to the US, as visa or entry waivers don't guarantee access, reflecting rising immigration crackdown.

title: 'Nitish not stable, make his son Bihar CM': Rabri Devi over national anthem incident
content: RJD staged a protest against Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for insulting the national anthem. While the anthem was playing, Nitish conversed with his chief secretary and greeted people instead of standing in attention. Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav and former CM Rabri Devi criticized Nitish and questioned his mental stability, demanding his resignation and suggesting his son Nishant replace him.

title: March 2025 bank holidays: Are banks closed on Saturday, March 22, 2025?
content: Banks in India will be closed on March 22, 2025, as it is the fourth Saturday of the month. Additionally, banks in Jammu and Srinagar will be closed on March 27 and March 28 for Shab-I-Qadr and Jumat-ul-Vida, respectively.

title: Holocaust, 9/11 content gone: Pentagon scrubs thousands of articles
content: The Pentagon removed thousands of historical articles from its digital platforms, including those on the Holocaust, September 11, and cancer awareness. This has affected content across over 1,000 defence department websites. The removal process, involving automation, has led to the deletion of significant content requiring reassessment for potential republication.

title: Why judge blocked deportation of Indian researcher detained in US
content: A US federal judge temporarily halted the deportation of Indian scholar Badar Khan Suri, held over alleged ties to Hamas. His legal team claims he’s targeted for his academic and social media work. Suri's wife, a US citizen, is an outspoken critic of the Israeli government. There is no evidence of criminal activity, and he holds a valid visa.

title: Adani Energy Solutions bags Rs 2,800 crore transmission project in Gujarat
content: Adani Energy Solutions Ltd (AESL) has won a Rs 2,800 crore power transmission project in Gujarat to support green hydrogen and ammonia production in Mundra. The project, including a 75 km 765kV double-circuit line, will enhance AESL's transmission infrastructure, adding significant capacity.

title: 'We are looking for you': Trump threatens jail for those ‘sabotaging’ Tesla
content: US President Donald Trump warns vandals targeting Tesla vehicles, emphasizing that those caught could face up to 20 years in prison. This follows Attorney General Pam Bondi's statement on potential severe sentences for vandalizing Tesla, considered domestic terrorism due to the extensive damage inflicted.

title: IPL opening ceremony: How and where to watch, performers list
content: The 2025 IPL season will kick off on March 22 with an extravagant opening ceremony at Eden Gardens, Kolkata. The event will feature performances by Bollywood actress Disha Patani, singer Shreya Ghoshal, and Punjabi artist Karan Aujla, followed by the first match between KKR and RCB. Following the ceremony, defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) will take on Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in the tournament's opening match.

title: Aurangzeb row: Did burqa seller Fahim Khan's viral video fuel Nagpur violence?
content: Curfew was lifted in two police station areas in Nagpur with restrictions eased for two hours in six other areas. Police arrested 17 more suspects and detained four minors in connection with Monday night's riots. Fahim Khan, accused of spreading inflammatory content, faces sedition charges.

title: TCS, Infosys stocks see sharp decline - what’s the outlook?
content: Accenture's quarterly results have caused concerns about growth prospects of Indian IT firms, leading to a significant drop in technology stocks such as TCS, HCL Tech, and Infosys.

title: Musk to get top-secret plan for potential war with China? Trump responds
content: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, will receive a top-secret Pentagon briefing on U.S. military strategies involving potential conflicts with China. This move raises concerns due to Musk's business interests in China and his advisory role to President Trump. The briefing aims to aid in Musk's efforts to reduce government spending on defense.

title: Tata group ties up with Musk’s Tesla - details here
content: Tata Group companies, including Tata AutoComp and TCS, have positioned themselves as essential suppliers to Tesla, contributing to $2 billion worth of components for FY24. Tesla is considering manufacturing in India and is in talks with Indian states and suppliers for expanded operations.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex rallies over 500 points; Nifty50 above 23,350
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Friday. While BSE Sensex crossed the 77,000 mark intraday, Nifty50 went above 23,400.

title: Passenger found dead on Air India flight after arrival in Lucknow
content: A 52-year-old passenger, Aashif Daulla Ansari, was found dead on an Air India flight upon arrival in Lucknow. Despite attempts by cabin crew and medical professionals onboard, he was unresponsive and later confirmed dead at the hospital. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of his death.

title: Ascetic, who claimed Uttarakhand CM is of Nepali origin, held in land fraud case
content: Swami Dineshanand Bharti was arrested by Roorkee police for his alleged involvement in a land fraud case. The arrest has stirred public speculation, considering his recent controversial remarks about CM Dhami's Nepali origin, suggesting possible political motives behind the timing.

title: Iftar party held at UP govt school, headmistress suspended
content: A headmistress in UP's Bulandshahr was suspended for allowing an 'iftar party' in a school classroom, violating conduct rules. The event, held with her permission after school hours, was recorded and shared online, prompting the suspension. This follows a similar incident at a Meerut university involving religious activities on campus.

title: When Shashi Kapoor gave green flag goals while talking about his late wife
content: Shashi Kapoor made his acting debut in the 1940s and became a prominent Bollywood hero in the 1960s, starring in numerous acclaimed films. He shared a deep bond with his wife Jennifer Kendal, joking that their connection spanned lifetimes. Shashi Kapoor passed away in 2017, while Jennifer died in 1984.

title: London's Heathrow airport closed, flights disrupted: What led to the power outage?
content: A massive fire at an electrical substation caused a power outage, resulting in Heathrow Airport's closure until March 21 midnight and disrupting flights. Over 16,300 homes in west London lost power, with 150 people evacuated. Emergency services deployed 70 firefighters to control the blaze. Authorities are investigating the fire's cause and warn of ongoing disruptions.

title: Last IPL hurrah for Dhoni, Rohit, Virat?
content: This IPL season might be the last for cricket legends like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni besides seasoned performers like Faf Du Plessis and Sunil Narine. While they have all shown glimpses of their impressive form, age and past injuries suggest their IPL careers are nearing an end.

title: Experts predict women's Final Four and 2025 national champion
content: no team seeded below no. 3 has ever won the NCAA women's college basketball title . despite being the no. 2 overall seed behind the Bruins, this season's top 16 seeds have at least two losses . the battle for the national championship feels more wide open .

title: Reshuffle in AAP: Saurabh Bharadwaj to lead Delhi unit, Sisodia for Punjab
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 Women's Bracket game! The tourney tips off Friday, 3/21 @ 11:30a ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Be sure to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: How each team can win the national title
content: the 2025 women's hockey tournament is set for the national championship . the top four seeds are moving on to play for the tournament . if the teams make it to the title game, it will mark the third consecutive year they'll meet in the final .

title: Ranking the 20 greatest freshman runs in men's March Madness history
content: Cooper Flagg is hoping to join a short list of freshmen to lead their teams to national championships . the national player of the year front-runner could join the group if he leads the Blue Devils to their sixth national title and first of the Jon Scheyer era .

title: 'Not the smartest thing I've ever done': UK's Pope follows through on promise to pay for gas
content: some fans will make the trip courtesy of the team's head coach, Mark Pope . Pope is staying true to his word and is now covering the costs of gas money for university students to attend the game in Milwaukee . he is also a spokesman for the u.s. gov. eric holder .

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Next season's breakout player for every team
content: the 2025 season is on the way and several budding players on our Way-Too-Early Top 25 teams are primed for breakout campaigns . incoming freshman running back Gideon Davidson could give Clemson's offense an immediate jolt .

title: 'You don't have courage': Shah’s sharp attack on Stalin over language row
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics.

title: AAP defends Delhi govt officials amid Parvesh Verma's 'thick-skinned' remark
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Will the White Sox lose 120 games again? Could someone else lose more?
content: the Chicago White Sox are putting the finishing touches on an MLB record 121-loss 2024 season . they have traded away their best player in a winter move and added, well, not a whole lot in free agency . the white Sox have parted ways with a bunch of veterans they had in 2024 .

title: Govt. committed to bring down casualties due to wildlife conflicts: Forest Minister
content: During International Day of Forests observance, the Minister reveals 969 people lost their lives due to wildlife-related incidents since 2016

title: Delhi court rejects Engineer Rashid’s bail plea
content: Delhi court denies bail to J&K MP Engineer Rashid in terror funding case; NIA opposes plea to attend Parliament

title: Over 830 athletes to participate in inter-collegiate sports meet at JNTU Kalikiri
content: Competitions will be held in six events — volleyball (20 teams), throwball (17 teams), kho-kho (12 teams), handball (10 teams), badminton, and table tennis (both eight teams)

title: After 15 years, Karaikal Kendriya Vidyalaya gets land for permanent building
content: The Puducherry government has allotted 8.6 acres of land at Poomangalam; the Central Public Works Department is all set to begin the construction work

title: 28 automated testing stations to ensure fitness of vehicles in Kerala soon: Minister
content: Initiative based on Central directive which stipulated that fitness testing for vehicles be fully automated from April 1

title: Jacaranda trees in full bloom at Munnar hill station
content: Originally planted by the British, the Jacaranda trees with its striking blue blossoms are locally known as neela vaaka

title: Take up track doubling between Villupuram and Thanjavur, passengers’ association urges Southern Railway GM
content: All the trains operated in the section run with high occupancy rate. Hence, there was a need for operation of more trains on this section, says the association

title: Diabetics consult doctors before fasting during Ramadan to adjust medications and monitor blood sugar levels : experts
content: Recognising and treating hypoglycemia symptoms, such as excessive sweating, giddiness, and tremors are crucial, say experts

title: Tiruchi Corporation to appoint new agencies to tackle stray cattle menace
content: Two private agencies will be appointed for the task;  One agency will operate in Zones II, III, and IV, and another in Zones I and V during day and night

title: Kalaignar Grand Library to feature state-of-the-art facilities with inclusive design to ensure barrier-free access
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin unveils foundation stone for the building through video conference from Chennai; the fully air-conditioned facility will have an auditorium with a seating capacity of 1,000

title: 300 ongoing projects should be completed by May 20, says Nellore MLA
content: Warns that any project that did not take off yet or progressing on a sluggish pace due to the laxity of the local leaders will be shifted to the neighbouring divisions

title: Misinformation spread over Delhi High Court Justice Yashwant Varma’s official home incident: Supreme Court
content: As per top court order, the High Court Chief Justice Upadhyaya would submit a report to Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna on March 21

title: Farmers arrested for protesting on railway track in  Tiruchi
content: A group of farmers, led by P. Ayyakannu, protested on the railway track at Odathurai delaying the Chennai-bound Vaigai Express by 30 minutes

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Kozhikode Corporation launches sports academy
content: Corporation Academy for Sports Kozhikode aims to nurture physical, mental well being of the citizens, irrespective of age or gender

title: We are not aware of Ranjani Srinivasan getting in touch with Indian embassy: MEA
content: Ranjani Srinivasan “self-deported” from the U.S. after her visa was revoked for allegedly involving in acitivities supporting Hamas

title: Kerala sanctions ₹500 crore more towards its share for Jal Jeevan Mission
content: Centre yet to release the second instalment for the 2024-25 fiscal, says Water Resources Minister Roshy Augustine

title: Union Minister Annpurna Devi seeks Supreme Court intervention on Allahabad HC’s ruling in sexual assault case
content: The Union Minister for Women and Child Development expresses concern over the broader implications of the judgment, warning that it could send the wrong message to society

title: Cultural show, awareness session mark World Down Syndrome Day programme
content: District Early Intervention Centre of the K.A.P.V. Government Medical College organised the programme under the aegis of the Indian Academy of Paediatrics

title: BJP demands Telangana govt to clarify how ₹3.04 lakh crore will be raised to match 2025-26 budget outlay
content: BJP floor leader Maheshwar Reddy describes Telangana 2025-26 budget as “full of lies” and far from reality

title: 18 BJP MLAs suspended for six months in Karnataka for ruckus in House over allegation of honey-trapping
content: In addition to a vociferous protest demanding a judicial or CBI probe, they also threw torn pieces of paper on the Speaker and the podium where his chair is located

title: CBI arrests senior GM of Power Grid Corporation of India for bribery
content: Uday Kumar, posted in Rajasthan's Ajmer, was arrested on Thursday along with Suman Singh of KEC International in Sikar where both had agreed to meet for alleged exchange of the bribe amount, said CBI

title: Over 97,000 complaints from PDS beneficiaries addressed, says T.N. Minister Sakkarapani
content: The complaints included delay in opening ration shops, selling essential commodities at higher prices, and distribution of poor quality of commodities, the Minister said

title: Issue cannot be hushed up by mere transfer: Congress on Delhi HC judge cash discovery row
content: Congress’s media and publicity department head Pawan Khera said the discovery of such a huge amount of cash from the judge’s house is a very serious matter, adding that it cannot be hushed up by transferring him

title: In northeast, new era of development ushered in after Modi government came to power, says Amit Shah in Rajya Sabha
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah was replying to the debate in Rajya Sabha on the working of the Home Ministry.

title: T.N. CM Stalin lays foundation stone for ₹290-crore Kalaignar grand library and intellectual centre in Tiruchi
content: Last year, Mr. Stalin had announced in the Assembly that a world-class library and intellectual centre would be established in the name of Kalaignar, former Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi

title: Schools in Meghalaya’s mining-affected East Jaintia Hills train minds against drugs through storytelling
content: ‘Ia ka Mynried’, meaning “for a better tomorrow” in the Pnar language, aims to address poor communication skills and substance abuse, especially among mining-affected communities

title: Nepalese student who died at KIIT had filed harassment complaint 11 months before: Minister
content: The Education Minister told the assembly that 19 people have so far appeared before the high-level committee set up by the State Government, to inquire into the girls's death and the subsequent harassment of those protesting it

title: Congress slams government over census delay, under-utilisation of Home Ministry funds
content: Congress criticises government for delayed census, underutilised budget, and security concerns in Rajya Sabha discussion.

title: MF Husain painting fetches over ₹118 crore, becomes most expensive modern Indian art
content: Gram Yatra, which means ‘village pilgrimage', is widely regarded as a cornerstone of Husain's oeuvre.

title: Woman who accused Maharashtra Minister Jaykumar Gore of harassment held for extortion: Police
content: “She had demanded ₹3 crore to end everything. She was caught red-handed accepting ₹1 crore of the total amount. Police are questioning the woman,” the official said

title: Team to be constituted to prevent pollution in Cauvery: Karnataka Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar
content: Referring to World Water Day, Mr. Shivakumar, who is also the Minister for Major and Minor Irrigation, said a week-long programme will be conducted to promote water conservation

title: Chief Minister Naidu proposes an exclusive trust for Lord Venkateswara temples
content: The Chief Minister urges philanthropists to contribute munificently to the noble cause and added that the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams would also contribute

title: Meghalaya ramps up TB detection, registers a 126 % surge in presumptive TB examinations
content: The State has brought in state-of-the-art technology to aid diagnosis, provides free transport to patients from home to healthcare facility, and gives nutritional support of ₹2,00 per month to help with recovery, officials said

title: Wayanad landslides: Kerala HC criticises Centre for not filing affidavit on March 31 deadline extension for rehab projects
content: When the petition came up, Central government’s standing council submits that the deadline will be extended to December 31, 2025

title: 100% hike in salaries of CM and legislators of Karnataka
content: Salaries of MLAs and MLCs doubled from ₹40,000 to ₹80,000 a month while the Chief Minister’s pay increased from ₹75,000 to ₹1.5 lakh

title: Four industrial parks to be set up in Parvatipuram-Manyam district of A.P.
content: We received several applications from entrepreneurs who are willing to set up agro-based industries in the district. Their proposals needed to be cleared by higher authorities and industrial promotion board, the District Collector said

title: How M-cups are slowly but surely transforming menstrual hygiene in south India
content: The Thinkal project, which distributes menstrual cups across south India and elsewhere, is beginning to gain ground; while hurdles with acceptance and misapprehensions remain, beneficiaries and doctors say there has been a positive change in menstrual hygiene

title: Kerala man gets life term for killing son-in-law, court orders to pay ₹2.5-lakh relief to daughter
content: Family dispute over financial situation of the deceased and the health of his child led to the killing

title: Delhi HC judge transfer over ‘cash discovery’: We are not ‘trash bin’, says Allahabad HC Bar Association
content: Supreme Court collegium headed by Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna has reportedly decided to transfer Justice Varma from the Delhi High Court to his parent Allahabad High Court

title: We have decided to give Morans in Arunachal Pradesh PRC of Assam: Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Cabinet decisions for the Morans and two other communities demanding Schedule Tribe status are seen as crucial a year ahead of polls in the State

title: AAP slams BJP over ‘thick-skinned’ remark, accuses Delhi Ministers of corruption, threats
content: AAP accuses BJP of pressuring officers for commission, escalating tensions between parties in Delhi post-election.

title: 37 flights from India likely to be hit as London Heathrow airport shuts after power outage
content: Air India has six daily flights to London; one of its Mumbai-London flights will be returning and a flight from New Delhi is being diverted to Frankfurt

title: Ashoka University launches School of Advanced Computing for interdisciplinary innovation
content: Ashoka University launched the Ashoka School of Advanced Computing (ASAC), which is aimed at redefining computer science education and research

title: KCET 2025 on April 15, 16, 17, and candidates can edit application after exam
content: The KCET exam will be held on April 16 and 17 while the Kannada exam for students from Gadinadu & Horanadu Kannadigaru will be conducted on April 15

title: Magisterial probe holds cops responsible for custodial death of Parbhani protester
content: “Perusal of the report of the magisterial inquiry shows that the judicial magistrate has concluded that Suryawanshi was assaulted at Nava Mondha, Police Station in Parbhani,” the Commission noted

title: Two more women arrested, two policemen suspended for assault on Dalit woman at Malpe harbour in Udupi
content: Earlier on March 19, police had arrested three persons — Laxmi Bai, Sundar and Shilpa — in connection with the assault in coastal Karnataka

title: Delhi HC grants bail to Unitech's Ramesh Chandra in ED case
content: The case stemmed from several FIRs registered by the Economic Offences Wing of the Delhi Police against the accused for various alleged offences, including cheating, criminal conspiracy, taking undue advantage by influencing public servants and bribing public servants

title: A.P. CM Chandrababu Naidu donates ₹44 lakhs to TTD Nitya Annadanam
content: CM Chandrababu Naidu gave his contribution to Nitya Annadanam (free meals scheme) at Tirumala on the occasion of his grandson Nara Devansh’s birthday

title: 'Recovery of cash' from residence of judge: Issue raised in Rajya Sabha
content: Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar said he will find a mechanism for holding a structured discussion on the issue

title: LDF urges ASHAs, anganwadi workers in Kerala not to fall prey to ‘anti-government conspiracy’
content: LDF convener T.P. Ramakrishnan says ASHAs and anganwadi workers should join forces with LDF and strengthen the hands of Kerala government which is at the forefront of national struggle to force Centre to cede to justifiable demands

title: Deeply shameful: Maliwal on Allahabad HC ruling in assault case
content: Ms. Maliwal questioned the message such a ruling sends to society, particularly regarding crimes against children

title: Indian cricketer Ravichandran Ashwin to have a Chennai street named after him
content: The decision to rename the street was based on a request received from Carrom Ball Event & Marketing Pvt. Ltd., whose Chief Operating Officer, S. Karthik highlighted Mr. Ashwin’s contributions to Indian cricket.

title: Opposition in Assam seeks motion against BJP's Sudhanshu Trivedi for calling Dhubri 'mini Bangladesh'
content: Leader of Opposition Debabrata Saikia of the Congress raised the demand for the condemnation motion against BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi

title: Telangana SSC examinations 2025 take off; day one passes smoothly
content: The DGE has allowed a grace period of five minutes for candidates to enter the examination centre beyond 9.30 a.m.

title: Saurabh Bharadwaj appointed Delhi AAP chief, Sisodia to head Punjab unit
content: Manish Sisodia takes charge of Punjab, the only State where the Aam Aadmi Party is currently in power

title: RSS terms controversies over language, delimitation as politically motivated to ‘create North-South divide’
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsewak Sangh’s top body began its meeting in Bengaluru and is expected to be attended by 1,482 people from the Sangh and its affiliated organisations

title: T.N. govt. presents final supplementary estimates for 2024-25
content: Placing the demand for the supplementary grants, Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu said the total estimates included ₹12,639.36 crore in revenue account, ₹6,429.20 crore in capital account, and ₹218.88 crore in loan account

title: Ruckus in Odisha Assembly as Congress protests over crimes against women
content: Speaker Surama Padhy calls an all-party meeting after multiple adjournments failed to normalise the situation.

title: Thoughts on the International Theatre Festival of Kerala and its inclusive framework
content: Ahead of World Theatre Day on March 27, a look at how the Kerala festival can serve as a template for a wholesome discourse on the arts across India

title: UDF stages walkout in Kerala Assembly over ASHA workers’ protest, accuses govt of neglect
content: Minister for Excise and Local Self-Government M.B. Rajesh, who spoke on behalf of CM, says talks with ASHAs failed because of ‘stubborn attitude’ of protest leaders who appeared to be ‘politically motivated’

title: Three Indian nationals face death penalty for smuggling drugs into Indonesia
content: At a press conference in Batam on July 17, 2024, Indonesian National Narcotic Agency chief Marthinus Hukom alleged that the three were the drug owners and had commissioned the trip

title: Telangana to roll out referral system to decongest govt. hospitals in Hyderabad: Health Minister
content: The Minister stressed the importance of ensuring accessibility to all diagnostic services, particularly for the economically disadvantaged sections of society

title: Seven aides of jailed Amritpal Singh remanded to 4-day police custody by Punjab court
content: Amritpal Singh and his associates have been in Assam's Dibrugarh jail under the NSA for the past two years; he had fought the 2024 Lok Sabha polls as an independent and won from the Khadoor Sahib seat

title: India’s Got Latent row: Samay Raina reschedules India tour
content: Raina got into trouble after YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia’s remarks on parents and sex at his now-deleted web show ‘India’s Got Latent’ led to a massive furore in February

title: Indian officials skip Pakistan national day celebrations
content: India has been maintaining that it desires normal neighbourly relations with Pakistan while insisting that the onus is on Islamabad to create an environment free of terror and hostility for such engagement

title: SC agrees to in-house enquiry into allegations of cash pile at Delhi HC judge’s residence
content: The Supreme Court Collegium is also in favour of Justice Yashwant Varma’s transfer out of Delhi back to Allahabad High Court, from where he had been transferred to the national capital in October 2021
